title: The Y2K millennium bug crisis in Australia | 7NEWS VAULT
description: As midnight approached on December 31, 1999, Australia held its breath. The Y2K "Millennium Bug" threatened to crash computers worldwide, potentially crippling power grids, banks, hospitals, and more.   "We would be like a planet full of blind people," experts warned.  Families were stockpiling water and food, banks were distributing emergency cash, Ansett grounded all flights and the government spent $12 billion to prevent the "catastrophe".  Supermarkets were emptied. Emergency services were on standby. The nation braced for digital doomsday.  And then... nothing happened.  A fascinating time capsule of mass hysteria and the greatest tech scare that never was. title: Stranded Coral Adventurer passengers return home
description: After hitting a coral reef and leaving passengers and staff stranded, the Coral Adventurer cruise liner returns home to Cairns. This was the Coral Adventurer's first voyage since the death of an elderly passenger who was left behind on an island. #coraladventurer #cruise #stranded

title: Massive security for New Year's Eve celebrations | 7NEWS
description: More than a million people are expected to gather across Australian cities for New Year's Eve 2026 celebrations, with Sydney hosting harbour fireworks, Melbourne presenting laser light shows, and Brisbane featuring new drone displays. Unprecedented security measures include over 2,500 officers in Sydney and Melbourne, with random weapon searches in Adelaide. A one-minute silence will be observed at 11pm for victims of the Bondi terror attack, while federal police confirm the Bondi gunman and his father acted alone after investigating their month-long Philippines visit. title: Million expected at Sydney's New Year's Eve | 7NEWS
description: Australian cities are preparing for New Year's Eve 2025-2026 celebrations with over a million people expected at Sydney Harbour, half a million in Melbourne's CBD, and major events in Brisbane and Adelaide. A minute's silence will be observed at 11pm for Bondi terror attack victims, and a Jewish menorah will feature on Sydney Harbour Bridge pylons. Unprecedented security measures include over 2,500 police officers in Sydney and Melbourne, some carrying long-armed weapons, with random weapon searches authorised in Adelaide and extensive transport arrangements across all cities. title: Bondi gunmen acted alone, found no evidence of terrorist training | 7NEWS
description: The Australian Federal Police have concluded that the Bondi gunman and his father acted alone in the attack that resulted in 15 murder charges. Investigators determined the pair spent a month in a hotel in the southern Philippines before the massacre, but found no evidence of terrorist training or wider conspiracy. NSW authorities have condemned a reported increase in Islamophobic attacks targeting Muslims following the Bondi massacre, including incidents of dead pigs being thrown at mosques and women being spat on for wearing traditional face coverings. title: Denmark ends 400 years of letter delivery | 7NEWS
description: Denmark's postal service, Post-Nord, has ceased letter delivery after 400 years of operation as digital communication has replaced traditional mail. Danes now send 90% fewer letters than a decade ago, though the service will continue delivering parcels and packages driven by online shopping demand. The final letter is on display at Denmark's Enigma Museum, marking the historic transition in the world's most digitalised country. title: Times Square gets double ball drop for New Year's Eve | 7NEWS
description: Times Square will feature two ball drops this New Year's Eve instead of the traditional single drop. The iconic Constellation Ball will drop at midnight, then drop again at four minutes past twelve in a red, blue and white design to commemorate 250 years since the signing of the Declaration of Independence, accompanied by 900 kilograms of confetti. Around one million people are expected to attend the celebration with thousands of police providing security, and snow is forecast for the evening. title: Did you achieve your New Year's resolutions?
description: Tomorrow marks the start of 2026, which means New Year's resolutions are being thrown around, so 7NEWS hit the streets to ask people if they made resolutions for the year just gone, and whether they actually kept them. #newyearsresolution #nye #newyears #2026 #newyear
